title: Polaris Dawn Slips Again For a Different Kind of Weather Problem
summary: SpaceX’s Polaris Dawn mission with four private astronauts just scrubbed again, the third night in a row.  This time the problem is weather, but not the usual delay because of […]

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 21 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral
summary: The mission comes on the heels of SpaceX having to stand down from launching the Polaris Dawn astronaut mission due to weather concerns. Liftoff is set for 2:54 a.m. EDT (0654 UTC) on Wednesday.

title: NASA IG Issues Another Harsh Report On NASA Management of Mobile Launcher-2
summary: NASA’s Office of Inspector General is again expressing deep concern about NASA’s management of Mobile Launcher-2, an enormous transporter needed to haul Space Launch System rockets to the launch pad […]

title: Experts warn U.S. falling behind in satellite imaging race: ‘We’ve gone backwards’
summary: Former NGA official David Gauthier says current NRO funding for commercial satellite imagery is insufficient to ensure U.S. competitiveness in the sector

title: Perseverance Kicks off the Crater Rim Campaign!
summary: Perseverance is officially headed into a new phase of scientific investigation on the Jezero Crater rim!

title: Independent Review Confirms Bad Valve Doomed Astrobotic’s Peregrine-1 Mission
summary: An independent review of the January failure of Astrobotic’s Peregrine-1 lunar lander has confirmed that a single bad valve doomed the mission. While designated a risk before launch because of […]

title: Polaris Dawn headlines this week’s launches; SpaceX to fly five Falcon 9s
summary: Another busy week of spaceflight activities contains up to five launches from SpaceX, including the Polaris Dawn mission, whose private crew will conduct an inspiring mission profile. Other SpaceX missions include three Starlink flights and another set of Starshield satellites to low-Earth orbit (LEO) for the National Reconnaissance Office. SpaceX has performed 81 launches of Falcon 9 so far this year.

title: NASA has to be trolling with the latest cost estimate of its SLS launch tower
summary: "NASA officials informed us they do not intend to request a fixed-price proposal."

title: NASA, Boeing Optimizing Vehicle Assembly Building High Bay for Future SLS Stage Production
summary: NASA is preparing space at the agency’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida for upcoming assembly activities of the SLS (Space Launch System) rocket core stage for future Artemis missions, beginning with Artemis III. Teams are currently outfitting the assembly building’s High Bay 2 for future vertical assembly of the rocket stage that will help power […]

title: Valve problem blamed for Peregrine lunar lander failure
summary: Astrobotic’s Peregrine lunar lander was unable to make it to the moon because of a failure of a single valve, leading to work to redesign the valve and overall propulsion system on the company’s larger Griffin lander.
